entries.name: EIA Form 923
entries.description: Monthly power plant operations data including generation by fuel type, fuel consumption, and fuel costs for ~3,000 U.S. power plants. Essential for electricity generation analysis.
entries.summary: The EIA Form 923 dataset contains monthly power plant operations data, detailing generation by fuel type, fuel consumption, and fuel costs for approximately 3,000 U.S. power plants. This dataset is essential for analyzing electricity generation trends and understanding the energy market.
use_cases: Analyzing trends in electricity generation by fuel type over time.
Evaluating the impact of fuel costs on power plant operations.
Comparing fuel consumption across different power plants.
Assessing the overall performance of the U.S. energy sector.

entries.name: EIA Form 860
entries.description: Generator-level data on capacity, technology, ownership, and location for all U.S. power plants from 1990-present. Includes planned additions and retirements.
entries.summary: The EIA Form 860 dataset provides generator-level data on capacity, technology, ownership, and location for all U.S. power plants from 1990 to the present. This dataset can be used to analyze trends in energy production, assess the impact of technology on capacity, and evaluate ownership structures within the energy sector.
use_cases: Analyzing trends in electricity generation capacity over time
Evaluating the impact of renewable energy technologies on the power grid
Assessing ownership structures of power plants across the U.S.
Forecasting future energy needs based on planned additions and retirements
synthetic_questions: What is the EIA Form 860 dataset?

What information does the EIA Form 860 provide?
How can I analyze energy capacity using EIA Form 860?

entries.name: FERC Form 714
entries.description: Hourly load data from ~200 U.S. balancing authorities. Essential for load shape analysis, demand forecasting, and understanding temporal patterns in electricity consumption.
entries.summary: The FERC Form 714 dataset contains hourly load data from approximately 200 U.S. balancing authorities. It is essential for load shape analysis, demand forecasting, and understanding temporal patterns in electricity consumption.
use_cases: Analyzing load shapes for different times of the day.
Forecasting electricity demand based on historical load data.
Studying temporal patterns in electricity consumption across regions.

entries.name: PUDL (Public Utility Data Liberation)
entries.description: Cleaned, integrated database combining EIA-860, EIA-861, EIA-923, FERC Form 1, and EPA CEMS into accessible SQLite/Parquet formats. Maintained by Catalyst Cooperative.
entries.summary: The PUDL dataset is a cleaned and integrated database that combines various energy-related data sources into accessible formats. It allows users to analyze public utility data for research and decision-making in the energy sector.

How can I access the PUDL database?

Is PUDL open source?
Where can I find energy utility data?

entries.name: EPA CEMS (Continuous Emissions Monitoring System)
entries.description: Hourly emissions data (SO2, NOx, CO2) from U.S. power plants since 1995. Billions of records with unit-level emissions and generation. Part of the Clean Air Markets Program.
entries.summary: The EPA CEMS dataset provides hourly emissions data for SO2, NOx, and CO2 from U.S. power plants since 1995. This extensive dataset allows for analysis of emissions trends, compliance with environmental regulations, and the impact of energy generation on air quality.
use_cases: Analyzing emissions trends over time
Comparing emissions across different power plants
Evaluating compliance with environmental regulations
Studying the impact of energy generation on air quality

entries.name: CAISO OASIS
entries.description: California ISO market data including day-ahead and real-time LMPs, renewable forecasts, curtailment, and ancillary service prices from 2009-present.
entries.summary: The CAISO OASIS dataset provides California ISO market data, including day-ahead and real-time locational marginal prices (LMPs), renewable forecasts, curtailment, and ancillary service prices from 2009 to the present. This data can be used for analyzing energy market trends, forecasting renewable energy production, and understanding pricing dynamics in the California energy market.
use_cases: Analyzing trends in energy pricing over time.
Forecasting renewable energy production based on historical data.
Evaluating the impact of curtailment on energy supply.
Studying the relationship between ancillary service prices and market demand.

entries.name: PJM Data Miner
entries.description: Eastern U.S. interconnection market data including LMPs back to 1998, capacity auction results, generation by fuel type, and transmission data.
entries.summary: The PJM Data Miner provides comprehensive market data for the Eastern U.S. interconnection, including locational marginal prices (LMPs), capacity auction results, and generation data by fuel type. This dataset can be utilized for analyzing market trends, energy pricing, and capacity planning.
use_cases: Analyzing trends in locational marginal prices over time.
Evaluating the impact of fuel type on generation capacity.
Conducting market simulations based on historical auction results.

entries.name: NREL NSRDB (National Solar Radiation Database)
entries.description: Solar irradiance data at 30-minute/4km resolution covering the Americas from 1998-present. Includes GHI, DNI, DHI and meteorological variables. Free API access.
entries.summary: The NREL NSRDB provides solar irradiance data at a 30-minute interval and 4km resolution, covering the Americas from 1998 to the present. This dataset includes Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI), Direct Normal Irradiance (DNI), Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance (DHI), and various meteorological variables, enabling users to analyze solar energy potential and trends.
use_cases: Analyzing solar energy potential for a specific location.
Comparing solar irradiance data across different regions.
Modeling solar energy generation based on historical data.
Assessing the impact of meteorological variables on solar energy production.

entries.name: Ember Global Electricity Data
entries.description: Monthly electricity generation, capacity, and emissions data for 88 geographies covering 90%+ of global electricity demand. Free, open data with CC BY license.
entries.summary: The Ember Global Electricity Data provides monthly statistics on electricity generation, capacity, and emissions across 88 geographies. This dataset can be utilized for analyzing trends in global electricity demand and assessing the impact of energy policies.
use_cases: Analyzing trends in electricity generation over time
Comparing emissions across different geographies
Evaluating the impact of renewable energy policies
Assessing capacity versus demand in global electricity markets

entries.name: gridstatus
entries.description: Python package providing unified API access to real-time and historical data from all major U.S. ISOs (CAISO, PJM, ERCOT, MISO, NYISO, ISO-NE, SPP).
entries.summary: The gridstatus dataset provides a unified API for accessing real-time and historical data from major U.S. Independent System Operators (ISOs). Users can leverage this data for analysis related to energy consumption, production, and market dynamics.
use_cases: Analyzing energy consumption patterns in different U.S. regions.
Comparing real-time energy prices across various ISOs.
Evaluating historical trends in energy production.
Developing applications that require real-time energy data.
